meanings.definition: Stupid or dull in appearance or expression.
meanings.sent1: The gormy cat just stared blankly at the wall.
meanings.sent2: She always felt a bit gormy when she woke up early.
meanings.sent3: The gormy puppy tried to chase its own tail but kept missing.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a gormy look, with peeling paint and overgrown bushes.
meanings.sent5: The gormy student struggled to understand the math problem.

meanings.sent1: The new kid at school seemed like a gormy to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a gormy in the big city, lost and confused.
meanings.sent3: The gormy in the office always made everyone laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: He was a gormy in the kitchen, always burning the toast.
meanings.sent5: The gormy at the party stood awkwardly in the corner, unsure of what to do.
